intro: Agrostophyllum paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its common name. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
